"Good Job"s for: Rooms (a bit tired, but nice kitchens, baths, furnishings and comfy Hilton beds), Exercise Room with water cooler, towels, TV and some weights, plus 2xTreadmills, 2xEllipticals, 1 Recumbent Bike - all NEW Precor with Cardio Theater TV's and near-pro gym quality) "Hot" Breakfast (better than Denny's but not quite up to Embassy Suites standards - but the price- Free - was right!), Shuttle Service (we didn't use but it was a great itinerary and they were flexible about pick-ups until around 9 pm. Great if you are tired after walking all over the city. Biggest Surprise: The price, just over $100 incl. tax for an admittedly quiet night, just after New Year's. The Last Words...This is a great place to stay if you want a quiet and close-by hotel to kick back (even play pool in their lounge!), with a weekday manager's reception, and to keep some food, drink around your room (big fridge, a microwave and a stovetop, plus a coffee maker and the bonus - Starbucks coffee always hot in the lobby, incl. real creamer. You can buy munchies from their quick selection but there are markets everywhere, including a fairly close QFC supermarket up on Capitol Hill, a mini mart by the Conv. Ctr. and a nice IGA with decent wine prices right down on 3rd Ave. off Pike. If you want to work out and not pay extra, it's a 24-hour fantastic value - so pick the "off-times" to avoid any crowds and get a real workout incl. in your room price. Or just head down the hill, to Pike Place, Pioneer Square, or the waterfront. You'll be walking lots, especially back up the hill to the hotel, but there's lots of food and drink along the way to cure what "ales" you... "Top Tips" nearby from a Local "Tourist": Pike Place Pub for beer and magnificent crab-stuffed Salmon filet. Everything's wild, food is best quality, beer brewed there has won awards. McCormick and Schmick's...great drinks, consistently better seafood, reasonable wine list values. Key Lime Pie that is more like cheesecake but puts others to shame! Avoid Rock Bottom, Tap House Grill has a great selection though...Want to see Seattle and its environs from the water - try Argosy Cruises, a family-owned company, and always focused on service and true value. or just hop a WS Ferry!

Reviews.Title: “we would always stay in this hotel when we are in seattle”
Reviews.Author: DowntownSeattle
Reviews.Content: a hotel of choice if traveling with family. we loved the rooms with a kitchen. best of all the hotel had free breakfast and free dinner. the front desk staff was wonderful. free shuttle to nearby downtown areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: tiaj2001
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly staff, and clean hotel. Our suite was very roomy. The free breakfast was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Comforts of home and more”
Reviews.Author: solo-traveller1209
Reviews.Content: I arrived on an early flight & arrived at the hotel just after 9am. The front desk staff welcomed me and immediately found me a suite even though check-in is not until 4pm! The complimentary breakfast was still open so I was also invited to enjoy breakfast! I couldn't have felt more welcome. The suite was spacious, clean and fully equipped. It was located away from the noisy Pike Street side. The breakfast had many selections both hot & cold and the evening reception was also substansial and included a selection of beer or wine. I noticed many families enjoying eating together morning and evening. The location was central and right next to the convention centre with its great free art exhibit . Great shopping and Pike Place Market are within walking distance. It was also within easy walking distance of the new SoundLink Light Rail station at Westlake Centre that connects with SeaTac airport for $2.50 one way

Reviews.Title: “Danielle, Dionne and Anthony, WORST STAFF EXPERIENCE EVER!”
Reviews.Author: lisakjack
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Saturday, Dec 5th. While the hotel nice and clean, good location. When I called down to ask when breakfast ended on Sunday morning at 5 after 10, I was told "it is over". When I asked if they could please save something and I'd be right down, DANIELLE at the front desk was RUDE and said, no, it's over. I asked to speak to the manager, who turned out to be another front desk person, Dionne. I was ill that day and called back in about an hour to ask to extend my stay and was told "no", because the front desk felt I was rude on the phone! I asked to speak to a manager again, and was given a "cell" phone number for "Anthony". When I called this number all I got was a voicemail. Checkout was 1pm. At 12:30, Dionne bangs on my door to remind me of checkout at 1PM. I was only able to call the customer service line, in DALLAS, TX! This was of no help. This staff basically kicked me out of the hotel over a phone call to ask about breakfast! I was alone, not making any noise and was ILL! I should not have even driven home that day. This was the worst hotel STAFF experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: wednesdayschild
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a great one-night stay here. This hotel has the best price-to-value ratio in downtown Seattle. The room rate includes a lot of extras, e.g. the shuttle that takes you to all the tourist spots, wi-fi, hot breakfast & happy hour. Did I forget anything? Oh, use of the billards room is included as well. The location looks a bit far away from Pike Place Market on a map but it's an easy 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. Less than 5 minutes in, this walk will take you thru the most vibrant part of the downtown core on Pike Street. My suite was comfortable, well-appointed, and most importantly clean as a whistle--particularly the bathroom! Another big plus is the super-friendly and efficient staff: check-in was smooth and gracious, and the staff who maintained the breakfast area seemed genuinely happy to be of service. Breakfast was substantial and hearty, although the hot foods could have been a little hotter. All in all, a terrific stay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location”
Reviews.Author: noirbidu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. I was surprised at the size of the king suit. The bathroom was huge. Also the gas fire in the living room was a nice touch. The parking was for a fee but it was valet parking with in and outs. Also the shuttle to Pike's Market and other tourist areas was a plus. It was great to call for a pickup after spending several hours shopping around the market. The only reason I don't give the hotel a top score was there was a strange smell in the hallway. I don't know if it was coming from the carpet or whatever they use to clean the carpet. They really need to do something about that.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay ever!!”
Reviews.Author: peacefulmind
Reviews.Content: I had read great reviews about this hotel so decided to book it. This was a business/leisure trip to Seattle. My husband was on a business trip and my toddler and I tagged along. We arrived at the hotel 10 am but the room wasn't ready and were told to come back at 4 pm although we didn't start on a very good note, as the gentleman at the front desk wasn't very nice specially considering that we had a small child and had been flying for 4 hours and tired. We were told to call back and find out if the room gets done sooner. I wish he had offered to call us instead as we were brand new in the city. However that didn't stop us from spending our entire day exploring downtown, walking down the Pike place market and also did the duck tour. When we got back we were greeted with smiles by 2 young ladies. Our room was clean, spacious, facing the street ( as we requested) and had a crib for our toddler. They served breakfast every morning which was really fresh and tasty and I am talking about 'real' breakfast. They had scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, milk, cereal, fruits, yogurt, coffee and more. I mean do we every go in such detail every day to prepare our breakfast at home. I thought that was great. The staff was super friendly right from the maids, to front desk, to shuttle driver to managers themselves. They have a laundry and a suite shop. They have a reception light dinner every evening. My husband and I thought the light dinner every night with wine and beer was the best touch ever. We loved how managers would interact with guest and be there for dinner. It was a different meal every day. After working all day my husband loved to unwind with a glass of cold beer. It worked out really good for us because with a toddler we couldn't venture out for dinner every night for 6 days. This was a fun way for us to enjoy ourselves in the comfort of our hotel. The hotel had a shuttle service which took guests to main tourist spots. I used it a few times during the day when my husband was gone to take my baby to the aquarium and children's museum. Our 5 day stay at Homewood suite was one of our best stays ever in any hotel. We travel a lot both domestic and international but never have experienced such great service. I may be wrong but one night for dinner reception the GM Greg was hosting it. He was very nice and friendly and we talked about some restaurants and cupcake shops. I thought it was very nice of a GM to be a part of his hotel team that way ( that is if he was the same Greg) My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel and even my super friendly toddler felt at home, She got smiles and compliments from all the staff members and I thought yes this sure is a kid friendly hotel :) I would recommend this hotel to any friend or family and can vouch for it. Let me assure ya'll this will be the best choice for a downtown hotel because of its location, friendly staff and service. You will not be disappointed. Have a fun stay!!

Reviews.Title: “an excellent and less expensive option to a city centre hotel, yet only 3 blocks away”
Reviews.Author: yyjguy
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at either the Sheraton or Hilton on 6th Avenue in the heart of the city. This trip I tried this new property and was very pleasantly surprised. It is only a 3 block walk up Pike St from the Sheraton. The price is much lower, as is the parking charge. The full hot breakfast was great and not offered at either the Sheraton or Hilton. Fully equipped kitchens where helpful as well. I've found a new favourite place to stay in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ragan10
Reviews.Content: The kitchen was big. I didn't feel crowded in the room at all. The staff would tell us the best location to go to on what night it is. When you come back into the hotel, they would smile and ask how your day is going.

Reviews.Title: “Want the WOW Effect This Hotel Has It All”
Reviews.Author: brijarjo3
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I spent 2 weeks at this hotel in August & September of 2009 from the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out we received nothing less than excellent service. We really felt as though we were at home and it was all because of the fantastic staff. The hotel is located in an excellent area of downtown Seattle with the convention center literally next door and the entire property is absolutely beautiful. We had a beautiful suite with stunning views of Seattle. Add to this the gracious and superb staff to get a truly WOW effect. The front desk staff greeted us by name when we left the hotel and when we returned they greeted us by saying "welcome home". The staff recommended great restaurants, not just any restaurants but ones where they had eatten which really made it even more inviting thanks so much to Priscilliana, Selena, Anthony, Jay, Jeremy, Megan and Belinda for all the great recommendations of restaurants, places to shop and even directions to the post office. And a great big thanks to all the other staff who we may not know your names but we will never forget your smiling faces and the excellent service we received during our stay. During the times when we just did not feel like walking down to Pike's Market or other areas of downtown Seattle all we had to do was let the front desk know and wait in the lobby for either Kelvin, Scott or Pete to let us know when it was time to go. Thanks guys for all the rides. A great big thanks to the entire staff for truly excellent services which has become almost extinct except for Homewood Suites by Hilton on Pike Street, Seattle, WA. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surpirse!!”
Reviews.Author: RAC22
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't stay here because the reviews were not as good as I would like and I was worried about the freeway noise. I was staying on points so I needed to stay at a Hilton so I said, "Ok, so it won't be perfect." But what a surprise. The location of course is great. I asked for an inside room, I got a huge suite with a deck and full kitchen and balcony overlooking an inside courtyard. Must have just been remodeled. Granite counter tops, seven pillows on my bed, fireplace, flat screen TV in the living room, very modern. The weather was perfect in Seattle but the room so nice I just wanted to hang out in the room. I didn't - but almost wished for a rainy day. Plus, this was the only hotel in the world that I have stayed that the valet parking actually worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: VikeFanFJ
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at this hotel and it was great. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. The common areas are clean and quiet. The rooms are spacious and nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: BonniebMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room and were very comfortable. The staff made sure we had everything we needed and were always friendly. The location is excellent because it is within walking distance to a lot of things. The breakfast each day was wonderful and we also liked the free food for happy hour in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Superfantastic”
Reviews.Author: SEGMN
Reviews.Content: Couldn't believe how nice the hotel staff was, everyone asking if we needed anything and making sure our stay was great. They had free beer and wine along with some food and it was very good and the breakfest was better than eating @ a Perkins. The hotel and our room was so clean, and everything that was within' walking distance was unbelieveable. I will totally stay here again on my next trip to the area. Job well done!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value with convenient, near-downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: Dankaran
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location that's convenient to downtown without being right in it. It was about a 20 minute walk to Pike Place Market and about 15 minutes to the Space Needle. So, if you're looking to be right in the thick of the city with enless options right outside your door, this may not be the right place. However, being a little off the side, this neighborhood, which is near trendy Queen Anne, is a slightly more relaxed, neighborhood-feeling location. The room was good. It was large, roomy, and pleasant but unremarkable. Definitely a good value in what tends to be a very expensive city for hotels. The most outstanding feature of the hotel was the staff! When I arrived, the room I was supposed to be in was not ready. So, the extremely helpful front desk clerk not only worked very quickly to resolve the situation but offered a significant room upgrade. And, most importantly, I felt that he truly took pride in his business establishment and was willing to work to ensure that my needs as a customer were met.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Seattle Convention Center Pike Street
HotelInfo.Address: 1011 Pike Street, Corner of Pike Street and Boren Avenue, Seattle, WA 98101
